author: Arsene Lupin III
subject: [OT] Netiquette & Slime (was: Battle Royale in NY)
body:
> Well yes, but I've mentioned anime that wasn't Lupin
> before. 

Hence why I brought it up. This is the Lupin III
mailing list.

As I have mentioned in the past, it is proper
"netiquette" to:
a)Remain on-topic if possible on a mailing list or
newsgroup, or if not always possible:
b)Note the off-topic nature of the string in the
subject header with the following 4 simple characters
preceding the actual subject:
[OT]

So, for example, this string, formerly "[lupin] Battle
Royale in NY" would read to the subscribers,
"[lupin][OT] Battle Royale in NY."

Real tough, huh? I would recommend that the readers of
this ML delete or ignore letters of an off-topic
nature if they are not appropriately treated as such.

I'm not trying to be rude or mean, Daniel. I'm just
trying to tell you that this is the Lupin the Third
mailing list. This is not a General Anime mailing
list, or a Japanese Film mailing list, or even the Joe
Don Baker mailing list. This is the Lupin III M.L. If
you wanna get off-topic, that's fine, but at least
tell us before you throw whatever nonsensical
fiddle-faddle into our Lupin-reserved mailboxes. :)
Thank you.
On with the off-topic string:

<Re: "The Green Slime">

> Well that's nice, but since you've never seen the
> film that Fukasaku did, 
> you really don't know what it's about.

Bwahahaha. If only you knew.

>From the Mystery Science Theater 3000 Information Club
Website:
---
Episode K00 - THE GREEN SLIME 
(1968; Japan/USA co-production; G; 90m)
a.k.a. GAMMA SANGO UCHU DAISAKUSEN (original/Japan)
Prod: Ivan Reiner
(scr/War Between the Planets)
Prod: Walter H. Manley
(816-Prince of Space**)
Assoc Prod: William Ross (also actor)
Dir: *KINJI FUKUSAKU* (Uchu Kara No Messeji; Tora!
Tora! Tora!)
(there are more details, truncated to save space). URL
is at:
http://www.mst3kinfo.com/daddyo/di_K00.html

**Prince of Space was a Japanese film mocked in the
8th season of MST3K.

Trivia: Reportedly, THE GREEN SLIME was the first
official Japanese-USA co-production of a movie. The
film's theme song was released as a single (in those
days...a 45 RPM record).
Special added note: This movie was never completely
riffed on by the Brains. Only bits and pieces were
used for the original MST3K demo tape.
--
Badda-bing.
Not worth my time, I've seen all I need to. 

> But ok. If you want me to mention something
> Lupinesque, this is vaguely 
> connected to it.

I believe I'm not the only one who would like this
ML's posters to try to stay on topic.

Interpret that as you will.

Gosh, I wish I could afford national-scale

Rupan III commercials on TV. With permission of
course.
Stupid lack of money.

See ya.
